item.description:
This event is open to Sea Kayaks (14' or longer with flotation) Only.
Water Temps are in the mid 40's. Wet or Dry Suits are required to participate in this paddle.

Low Tide at Merrimack River Entrance: 11:41 am.

We will depart Cashman Park at 10:30 am and paddle with the tide to the state park where we may see seals sunning themselves on the rocks at low tide. We will stop at the state park, take a break, and have a cookout while we wait for the tide to turn. There are grills to cook on and a pavilion with picnic tables and walls to block the wind. I will bring the charcoal, so bring something to grill if you would like. Then we will return to Cashman park with the tide. Total distance paddled will be 7 – 7 ½ Miles.

As always, PFD's (Life Jackets) are required when paddling with this group.


Directions:

Type “Cashman Park, Newburyport MA” into your GPS and do what it tells you to!

Alternately, you can:

1)I-95 S toward Hampton/Boston (Toll Road)
2)Take exit 58 and Turn Right to MA-110 E/Macy St
3)Follow MA-110 E/Macy St for ½ Mile.
4)Turn Right onto Merrill Street
5)Follow Merrill Street for 0.7 Mile.
6)Continue Straight on Spofford Street for 0.4 Mile.
7)Turn Left on Merrimac Street / MA-314 North
8)follow Merrimac Street / MA-314 North for 1.7 Miles
9)Turn Right onto Sally Snyder Way.
10)Cashman Park is at the end of the street, on the right.

Google Maps Link to Cashman Park

Thanks Rob!
item.name: Merrimack River Seal Watching
